VisualViewport.summary: The VisualViewport interface of the {{domxref("Visual Viewport API", "", "", "nocode")}} represents the visual viewport for a given window. For a page containing iframes, each iframe, as well as the containing page, will have a unique window object. Each window on a page will have a unique VisualViewport representing the properties associated with that window.

remarks.para: You can get a window's visual viewport using .

blockquote.para: Only the top-level window has a visual viewport that's distinct from the layout viewport. Therefore, it's generally only the VisualViewport object of the top-level window that's useful. For an {{htmlelement("iframe")}}, visual viewport metrics like always correspond to layout viewport metrics like .

VisualViewportHeight.summary: The height read-only property of the interface returns the height of the visual viewport, in CSS pixels, or 0 if current document is not fully active.

VisualViewportOffsetLeft.summary: The offsetLeft read-only property of the interface returns the offset of the left edge of the visual viewport from the left edge of the layout viewport in CSS pixels, or 0 if current document is not fully active.

VisualViewportOffsetTop.summary: The offsetTop read-only property of the interface returns the offset of the top edge of the visual viewport from the top edge of the layout viewport in CSS pixels, or 0 if current document is not fully active.

VisualViewportPageLeft.summary: The pageLeft read-only property of the interface returns the x coordinate of the left edge of the visual viewport relative to the initial containing block origin, in CSS pixels, or 0 if current document is not fully active.

VisualViewportPageTop.summary: The pageTop read-only property of the interface returns the y coordinate of the top edge of the visual viewport relative to the initial containing block origin, in CSS pixels, or 0 if current document is not fully active.

VisualViewportResize.summary: The resize event of the interface is fired when the visual viewport is resized. This allows you to position elements relative to the visual viewport as it is zoomed, which would normally be anchored to the layout viewport.

VisualViewportScale.summary: The scale read-only property of the interface returns the pinch-zoom scaling factor applied to the visual viewport, or 0 if current document is not fully active, or 1 if there is no output device.

VisualViewportScrollend.summary: The scrollend event of the interface is fired when a scrolling operation on the visual viewport ends. This allows you to update an element when a scrolling action is completed. For example, you could use the and events to keep an element fixed to the visual viewport as it is pinch-zoomed and scrolled, and update it with new content when scrolling ends using scrollend.

VisualViewportScroll.summary: The scroll event of the interface is fired when the visual viewport is scrolled. This allows you to position elements relative to the visual viewport as it is scrolled, which would normally be anchored to the layout viewport.

VisualViewportWidth.summary: The width read-only property of the interface returns the width of the visual viewport, in CSS pixels, or 0 if current document is not fully active.
